segment.source: Merge AppLocker policies manually (Windows 10)
segment.target: Merge AppLocker policies manually (Windows 10)

segment.source: This topic for IT professionals describes the steps to manually merge AppLocker policies to update the Group Policy Object (GPO).
segment.target: This topic for IT professionals describes the steps to manually merge AppLocker policies to update the Group Policy Object (GPO).

segment.source: Merge AppLocker policies manually
segment.target: Merge AppLocker policies manually

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: This topic for IT professionals describes the steps to manually merge AppLocker policies to update the Group Policy Object (GPO).
segment.target: This topic for IT professionals describes the steps to manually merge AppLocker policies to update the Group Policy Object (GPO).

segment.source: If you have created multiple AppLocker policies and need to merge them to create one AppLocker policy, you can either manually merge the policies or use the Windows PowerShell cmdlets for AppLocker.
segment.target: If you have created multiple AppLocker policies and need to merge them to create one AppLocker policy, you can either manually merge the policies or use the Windows PowerShell cmdlets for AppLocker.

segment.source: You cannot automatically merge policies by using the AppLocker console.
segment.target: You cannot automatically merge policies by using the AppLocker console.

segment.source: You must create one rule collection from two or more policies.
segment.target: You must create one rule collection from two or more policies.

segment.source: For info about merging policies by using the cmdlet, see Merge AppLocker policies by using Set-ApplockerPolicy.
segment.target: For info about merging policies by using the cmdlet, see Merge AppLocker policies by using Set-ApplockerPolicy.

segment.source: The AppLocker policy is saved in XML format, and the exported policy can be edited with any text or XML editor.
segment.target: The AppLocker policy is saved in XML format, and the exported policy can be edited with any text or XML editor.

segment.source: Rule collections are specified within the RuleCollection Type element.
segment.target: Rule collections are specified within the RuleCollection Type element.

segment.source: The XML schema includes five attributes for the different rule collections, as shown in the following table:
segment.target: The XML schema includes five attributes for the different rule collections, as shown in the following table:

segment.source: Rule collection
segment.target: Rule collection

segment.source: RuleCollection Type element
segment.target: RuleCollection Type element

segment.source: Executable rules
segment.target: Executable rules

segment.source: Exe
segment.target: Exe

segment.source: Windows Installer rules
segment.target: Windows Installer rules

segment.source: Msi
segment.target: Msi

segment.source: Script rules
segment.target: Script rules

segment.source: Script
segment.target: Script

segment.source: DLL rules
segment.target: DLL rules

segment.source: Dll
segment.target: Dll

segment.source: Packaged apps and packaged app installers
segment.target: Packaged apps and packaged app installers

segment.source: Appx
segment.target: Appx

segment.source: Rule enforcement is specified with the EnforcementMode element.
segment.target: Rule enforcement is specified with the EnforcementMode element.

segment.source: The three enforcement modes in the XML correspond to the three enforcement modes in the AppLocker console, as shown in the following table:
segment.target: The three enforcement modes in the XML correspond to the three enforcement modes in the AppLocker console, as shown in the following table:

segment.source: XML enforcement mode
segment.target: XML enforcement mode

segment.source: Enforcement mode in Group Policy
segment.target: Enforcement mode in Group Policy

segment.source: NotConfigured
segment.target: NotConfigured

segment.source: Not configured (rules are enforced)
segment.target: Not configured (rules are enforced)

segment.source: AuditOnly
segment.target: AuditOnly

segment.source: Audit only
segment.target: Audit only

segment.source: Enabled
segment.target: Enabled

segment.source: Enforce rules
segment.target: Enforce rules

segment.source: Each of the three condition types use specific elements.
segment.target: Each of the three condition types use specific elements.

segment.source: For XML examples of the different rule types, see Merge AppLocker policies manually.
segment.target: For XML examples of the different rule types, see Merge AppLocker policies manually.

segment.source: Membership in the local Administrators group, or equivalent, is the minimum required to complete this procedure.
segment.target: Membership in the local Administrators group, or equivalent, is the minimum required to complete this procedure.

segment.source: To merge two or more AppLocker policies
segment.target: To merge two or more AppLocker policies

segment.source: Open an XML policy file in a text editor or XML editor, such as Notepad.
segment.target: Open an XML policy file in a text editor or XML editor, such as Notepad.

segment.source: Select the rule collection where you want to copy rules from.
segment.target: Select the rule collection where you want to copy rules from.

segment.source: Select the rules that you want to add to another policy file, and then copy the text.
segment.target: Select the rules that you want to add to another policy file, and then copy the text.

segment.source: Open the policy where you want to add the copied rules.
segment.target: Open the policy where you want to add the copied rules.

segment.source: Select and expand the rule collection where you want to add the rules.
segment.target: Select and expand the rule collection where you want to add the rules.

segment.source: At the bottom of the rule list for the collection, after the closing element, paste the rules that you copied from the first policy file.
segment.target: At the bottom of the rule list for the collection, after the closing element, paste the rules that you copied from the first policy file.

segment.source: Verify that the opening and closing elements are intact, and then save the policy.
segment.target: Verify that the opening and closing elements are intact, and then save the policy.

segment.source: Upload the policy to a reference computer to ensure that it is functioning properly within the GPO.
segment.target: Upload the policy to a reference computer to ensure that it is functioning properly within the GPO.
